test_description: This test covers conceptual modeling using ER and EER models, including entities, relationships, attributes, keys, and advanced concepts like generalization/specialization.

questions.question: What is an entity in the ER model?
questions.options_a: A distinct object or concept about which data is stored

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a type of attribute in ER modeling?
questions.options_a: Simple attribute

questions.question: What is a weak entity type?
questions.options_a: An entity that depends on another entity for its existence
questions.options_c: An entity with only one instance
questions.options_d: An entity that cannot participate in relationships

questions.question: What does a diamond represent in an ER diagram?
questions.options_a: Entity

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a type of relationship cardinality?
questions.options_a: One-to-one

questions.question: What is the purpose of a partial key in a weak entity?
questions.options_a: To uniquely identify weak entity instances when combined with owner key

questions.question: What does generalization represent in EER modeling?
questions.options_a: Bottom-up process of defining superclasses from subclasses
questions.options_b: Top-down process of defining subclasses from superclasses

questions.question: Which symbol is used to represent specialization in EER diagrams?
questions.options_a: Circle

questions.question: What is the purpose of aggregation in EER modeling?
questions.options_a: To treat relationships as higher-level entities

questions.question: Which of the following is a constraint that can be applied to specialization?
questions.options_a: Disjointness constraint

questions.question: What is a composite attribute?
questions.options_a: An attribute that can be divided into smaller parts
questions.options_b: An attribute derived from other attributes
questions.options_c: An attribute that is a key

questions.question: Which of the following is true about a derived attribute?
questions.options_a: Its value can be calculated from other attributes
questions.options_b: It must be part of a key

questions.question: What is the degree of a relationship?
questions.options_a: Number of participating entity types
questions.options_b: Number of instances in a relationship

questions.question: Which constraint specifies that an entity must participate in a relationship?
questions.options_a: Participation constraint

questions.question: What is the purpose of a discriminator in specialization?
questions.options_a: To determine which subclass an entity belongs to

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a valid completeness constraint for specialization?
questions.options_a: Total

questions.question: What does a double rectangle represent in EER diagrams?
questions.options_a: Weak entity

questions.question: Which of the following is true about a multivalued attribute?
questions.options_a: It can have multiple values for a single entity
questions.options_b: It must be part of a key

questions.question: What is the difference between specialization and generalization?
questions.options_a: Specialization is top-down, generalization is bottom-up
questions.options_b: Specialization is bottom-up, generalization is top-down
questions.options_d: Specialization applies to attributes, generalization to entities

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT represented in an ER diagram?
questions.options_a: Entities
